div.l: What whilke way is he gon̄ he gan to crye
The wife came lepyng inwarde with a renne
Sche seide allas youre hors goth to the Fenne
Wᵗith wilde mares as faste as he may goo
Vnthanke come on his heed þᵗat bande hym soo
And he þat better schold haue knytt þe reyne
Allas qduod Iohn / Aleyn for Cristes peyne
Ley doun þi swerd and y woll myn also
I am full wight god wote as is a Roo
Be goddis hert he schal not scape vs bathe
Why ne haddest þou put þe capul in þe lathe
Il haill aleyn̄ be god þou is a Fonne
Thise sely Clerkis haue ful swithe ronne
Toward the Fen̄ // bothe Aleyn̄ and Iohn
And when þe Miller sawe þei were agoon̄
He half a busshell of here floure hath take
And bade his wyfe to knede it on a cake
He seide y trowe þe Clerkys been aferde
Yit can a Miller make a Clerkys berde
For all here art / ye lete hem goo her wey
Loo wher þey goo // ye lete þe Children pley
Þei gete hym not so lightly be my Croun̄
Thise sely Clerkys ronnen vp and doun̄
Wᵗith kepe kepe stonde stonde iossa war þe rere
Go whistel þere / and y schal kepe hym here
But schortly til w w it was verrey nyght
They cowde not for all here myght
The Capul cacche / he ran alwey so faste
Till in a diche þei cauthe hym at þe laste
¶ Wery and wete as beste is in the reyn̄
Comyth sely Iohn and wᵗith hym aleyn
Allas qduod Iohn þat day þat y was born̄
Nowe ar we drevyn to hethyng ⁊and to scorn̄
Oure corn̄ is stole / men woll vs fonnes calle
Bothe þe wardeyn̄ and oure felowes alle
And namly the Millere well awey
Þus pleynethpleyethpleyneth Iohn as he goth bi þe wey
Toward þe Mille and bayard in his hond
The Miller sittyng bi þe fire he fond
For it was nyght ⁊and forþer myght þei nowth
But for þe loue of god þei hym be south
Of herborowe ⁊and ease as for here peny
Þe Miller seide a yen̄ / if her be eny
Suche as it is yit schal ye haue youre part
Myn hous is streyte but ye haue lerned art
Ye konne by Argumentis make a place
A myle brode of xxᵗⁱ foot of space
Lete se nowe if þis place may suffice
Or make it rowmer wᵗith speche as is yoᵘur gise

l.note: "+" at left of redundant line to mark deletion
l.hi: Lete see nowe if þis place may suffice

div.l: Now Symond seyd þis Iohn bi Seynt Cuthberd
Ay is þou mery and þat is faire answerde
I haue herd say a man schal take oon of two thyngis
Suche as he fyndes / or suche as he bryngis
